<h1 align="center">ğŸš€ Ariadne</h1>

<p align="center">
  <strong>Intelligent Quantum Circuit Router</strong><br>
  Automatic backend selection for quantum circuit simulation based on circuit analysis
</p>

## ğŸŒŸ What Makes Ariadne Special?

Ariadne revolutionizes quantum circuit simulation by **automatically selecting the optimal backend** for your circuits. No more manual backend selection, no more performance guessworkâ€”just intelligent routing based on rigorous circuit analysis.

<div align="center">

```python
from ariadne import simulate
from qiskit import QuantumCircuit

# Create any quantum circuit
qc = QuantumCircuit(3, 3)
qc.h(0)
qc.cx(0, 1)
qc.cx(1, 2)
qc.measure_all()

# ğŸ¯ Ariadne automatically selects the best backend
result = simulate(qc, shots=1000)

print(f"ğŸ”§ Backend used: {result.backend_used}")
print(f"â±ï¸  Execution time: {result.execution_time:.3f}s")
print(f"ğŸ“Š Results: {dict(result.counts)}")
```

</div>

### ğŸ† Key Features

<table>
<tr>
<td width="50%">

**ğŸ¤– Intelligent Routing**
- Automatic circuit analysis
- Optimal backend selection
- Performance prediction
- Transparent decision making

**âš¡ Multi-Backend Support**
- Stim (Clifford circuits)
- Qiskit Aer (general purpose)
- MPS (low entanglement)
- Tensor Networks
- Hardware acceleration (CUDA/Metal)

</td>
<td width="50%">

**ğŸ“ Educational Focus**
- Interactive circuit builder
- 15+ quantum algorithms
- Step-by-step tutorials
- Cross-platform examples

**ğŸ”¬ Research Ready**
- Reproducible results
- Backend comparison tools
- Performance benchmarking
- Comprehensive validation

</td>
</tr>
</table>

## ğŸ“ˆ Performance That Speaks

<div align="center">

| Circuit Type | Traditional Approach | **Ariadne Router** | Performance Gain |
|:-------------|:-------------------:|:-----------------:|:----------------:|
| **Clifford Circuits** | Manual Stim setup | ğŸ¯ Auto-routed to Stim | **100,000+ shots/sec** |
| **Low Entanglement** | Trial & error | ğŸ¯ Auto-routed to MPS | **10-50x faster** |
| **Large Circuits** | One-size-fits-all | ğŸ¯ Hardware-optimized | **2-25x faster** |
| **General Circuits** | Manual optimization | ğŸ¯ Intelligent fallback | **Consistent performance** |

*Benchmarks run on Apple Silicon M4 Max with 128GB RAM*

</div>

## âš¡ Lightning Quick Start

### ğŸ“¦ Installation Options

<div align="center">

```bash
# ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸ Basic installation (recommended for most users)
pip install ariadne-router

# ğŸ Apple Silicon acceleration (M1/M2/M3/M4)
pip install ariadne-router[apple]

# ğŸš€ NVIDIA GPU acceleration
pip install ariadne-router[cuda]

# ğŸŒŒ All quantum platform backends
pip install ariadne-router[quantum_platforms]

# ğŸ”¬ Complete development setup
pip install ariadne-router[dev,apple,viz,quantum_platforms]
```

</div>

### ğŸ¯ Your First Quantum Circuit

<details>
<summary><strong>ğŸ”¥ Click to see a complete example</strong></summary>

```python
from ariadne import simulate, explain_routing, get_available_backends
from qiskit import QuantumCircuit
import time

# ğŸ§ª Create a 40-qubit GHZ state (challenging for most simulators)
print("ğŸ”¬ Creating 40-qubit GHZ state circuit...")
qc = QuantumCircuit(40, 40)
qc.h(0)
for i in range(39):
    qc.cx(i, i + 1)
qc.measure_all()

# ğŸ“Š Check available backends
backends = get_available_backends()
print(f"ğŸ”§ Available backends: {', '.join(backends)}")

# ğŸ¯ Let Ariadne choose the optimal backend
print("\nğŸš€ Running simulation with automatic backend selection...")
start_time = time.time()
result = simulate(qc, shots=1000)
duration = time.time() - start_time

# ğŸ“ˆ Display results
print(f"\nâœ… Simulation completed!")
print(f"ğŸ”§ Backend selected: {result.backend_used}")
print(f"â±ï¸  Total time: {duration:.3f}s")
print(f"ğŸ“Š Sample results: {dict(list(result.counts.items())[:3])}...")

# ğŸ§  Understand the routing decision
explanation = explain_routing(qc)
print(f"\nğŸ§  Routing explanation: {explanation}")
```

**Expected Output:**
```
ğŸ”¬ Creating 40-qubit GHZ state circuit...
ğŸ”§ Available backends: stim, qiskit, mps

ğŸš€ Running simulation with automatic backend selection...

âœ… Simulation completed!
ğŸ”§ Backend selected: stim
â±ï¸  Total time: 0.023s
ğŸ“Š Sample results: {'0000000000000000000000000000000000000000': 518, '1111111111111111111111111111111111111111': 482}

ğŸ§  Routing explanation: Clifford circuit detected â†’ routed to Stim for optimal performance (100,000+ shots/sec capability)
```

</details>

> **ğŸ’¡ Pro Tip:** The package installs as `ariadne-router` but imports as `ariadne`. This avoids conflicts with the [Ariadne GraphQL library](https://ariadnegraphql.org/).

---

## ğŸ§  How Ariadne's Intelligence Works

Ariadne uses a sophisticated **multi-stage analysis pipeline** to select the optimal backend:

<div align="center">

```mermaid
graph TB
    subgraph "ğŸ” Circuit Analysis Phase"
        A[ğŸ“Š Circuit Input] --> B[ğŸ” Clifford Detection]
        A --> C[ğŸ§® Topology Analysis]
        A --> D[ğŸ•¸ï¸ Entanglement Estimation]
        A --> E[ğŸ“ Resource Calculation]
    end

    subgraph "ğŸ¯ Decision Engine"
        B --> F{ğŸ¤– Routing Logic}
        C --> F
        D --> F
        E --> F
        G[ğŸ”§ Backend Availability] --> F
        H[âš¡ Hardware Detection] --> F
    end

    subgraph "ğŸš€ Execution"
        F --> I[âœ¨ Optimal Backend]
        I --> J[ğŸ“ˆ Performance Monitoring]
        J --> K[ğŸ“Š Results + Metrics]
    end

    style A fill:#e1f5fe
    style F fill:#fff3e0
    style I fill:#e8f5e8
    style K fill:#fce4ec
```

</div>

### ğŸ¯ Intelligent Backend Selection

<table>
<tr>
<th width="25%">ğŸ” Circuit Analysis</th>
<th width="25%">ğŸ¯ Backend Choice</th>
<th width="25%">âš¡ Performance</th>
<th width="25%">ğŸ“Š Use Cases</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>Clifford Circuits</strong><br/>H, S, CNOT, Pauli gates only</td>
<td><strong>Stim Backend</strong><br/>Specialized stabilizer simulator</td>
<td><strong>100,000+ shots/sec</strong><br/>Linear scaling</td>
<td>Error correction<br/>Stabilizer codes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>Low Entanglement</strong><br/>Limited quantum correlations</td>
<td><strong>MPS Backend</strong><br/>Matrix Product States</td>
<td><strong>1,000-10,000 shots/sec</strong><br/>Efficient for Ï‡ < 100</td>
<td>QAOA circuits<br/>Shallow algorithms</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>Structured Topology</strong><br/>Specific connectivity patterns</td>
<td><strong>Tensor Networks</strong><br/>Optimized contractions</td>
<td><strong>Varies by structure</strong><br/>Pattern-dependent</td>
<td>Grid layouts<br/>Nearest-neighbor only</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>General Circuits</strong><br/>Universal gate sets</td>
<td><strong>Qiskit Aer</strong><br/>Reliable fallback</td>
<td><strong>10-1000 shots/sec</strong><br/>Hardware dependent</td>
<td>Algorithm development<br/>General research</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>Hardware Available</strong><br/>GPU/Metal acceleration</td>
<td><strong>CUDA/Metal Backends</strong><br/>Platform optimization</td>
<td><strong>5-50x acceleration</strong><br/>Hardware dependent</td>
<td>Large-scale simulation<br/>Production workloads</td>
</tr>
</table>

## ğŸ“ Educational Excellence

### ğŸ“š Interactive Learning Environment

<details>
<summary><strong>ğŸ¯ Interactive Circuit Builder</strong></summary>

```python
from ariadne import InteractiveCircuitBuilder, simulate

# ğŸ—ï¸ Build circuits with educational guidance
builder = InteractiveCircuitBuilder(2, "Bell State Creation")
builder.add_hadamard(0,
    "Create superposition",
    "The Hadamard gate puts qubit 0 into |+âŸ© = (|0âŸ© + |1âŸ©)/âˆš2"
)
builder.add_cnot(0, 1,
    "Create entanglement",
    "CNOT creates the maximally entangled Bell state |Î¦+âŸ© = (|00âŸ© + |11âŸ©)/âˆš2"
)

# ğŸ§ª Execute with automatic backend selection
circuit = builder.get_circuit()
result = simulate(circuit, shots=1000)

# ğŸ“Š Educational output
print(f"ğŸ”¬ Circuit created: {builder.description}")
print(f"ğŸ¯ Backend used: {result.backend_used}")
print(f"ğŸ“Š Bell state results: {dict(result.counts)}")
# Expected: ~50% |00âŸ©, ~50% |11âŸ© (perfect entanglement)
```

</details>

### ğŸ§® Algorithm Library (15+ Implementations)

<details>
<summary><strong>ğŸš€ Explore quantum algorithms</strong></summary>

```python
from ariadne import list_algorithms, get_algorithm, run_algorithm

# ğŸ” Discover available algorithms
algorithms = list_algorithms()
print(f"ğŸ“š Available algorithms: {algorithms}")
# ['bell', 'deutsch_jozsa', 'grover', 'simon', 'shor', 'vqe', 'qaoa', ...]

# ğŸ“– Get detailed algorithm information
grover_info = get_algorithm('grover')
print(f"ğŸ¯ {grover_info['metadata'].name}")
print(f"ğŸ“ Description: {grover_info['metadata'].description}")
print(f"â±ï¸  Complexity: {grover_info['metadata'].complexity}")

# ğŸš€ Run Grover's algorithm (4-qubit search)
result = run_algorithm('grover',
    n_qubits=4,
    marked_items=[6, 10],
    shots=1024
)
print(f"ğŸ” Search results: {result.counts}")
print(f"âœ… Success probability: {result.success_probability:.1%}")
```

</details>

## ğŸ”¬ Advanced Features for Researchers

### ğŸ“Š Backend Comparison & Benchmarking

<details>
<summary><strong>ğŸ¯ Performance Analysis Tools</strong></summary>

```python
from ariadne.enhanced_benchmarking import EnhancedBenchmarkSuite
from ariadne import RoutingStrategy
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# ğŸ”¬ Create comprehensive benchmark suite
suite = EnhancedBenchmarkSuite()

# ğŸ§ª Test circuit across multiple backends
qc = create_random_circuit(n_qubits=20, depth=50)
comparison = suite.benchmark_backend_comparison(
    circuit=qc,
    backends=['auto', 'qiskit', 'stim', 'mps'],
    shots=1000,
    trials=5
)

# ğŸ“Š Analyze results
for backend, metrics in comparison.items():
    print(f"ğŸ”§ {backend:10s}: {metrics.mean_time:.3f}s Â± {metrics.std_time:.3f}s")

# ğŸ“ˆ Generate performance visualization
suite.plot_comparison(comparison, save_path='performance_comparison.png')

# ğŸ¯ Test different routing strategies
strategies = [RoutingStrategy.SPEED_FIRST, RoutingStrategy.ACCURACY_FIRST, RoutingStrategy.MEMORY_EFFICIENT]
strategy_results = {}
for strategy in strategies:
    result = suite.benchmark_strategy(qc, strategy=strategy, shots=1000)
    strategy_results[strategy.name] = result
```

</details>

### ğŸ”„ Reproducibility Tools

<details>
<summary><strong>ğŸ“‹ Cross-Backend Validation</strong></summary>

```bash
# ğŸ§ª Validate circuits across all available backends
python -m ariadne repro --circuit ghz_20 \
  --backends qiskit,stim,mps \
  --shots 1024 \
  --tolerance 0.05 \
  --output validation_report.json

# ğŸ“Š Generate reproducibility report
python -m ariadne repro --generate-report \
  --input validation_report.json \
  --format html \
  --output reproducibility_report.html

# ğŸ“ˆ Benchmark standard circuits
python -m ariadne datasets generate --family all --sizes 10,20,30,40
python -m ariadne benchmark --dataset standard_circuits --export-csv results.csv
```

</details>

---

## ğŸ³ Production-Ready Deployment

### ğŸš€ Docker Support

<details>
<summary><strong>ğŸ”§ Container Deployment Options</strong></summary>

```bash
# ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸ Quick start with latest release
docker pull ghcr.io/hmbown/ariadne-router:latest
docker run --rm ghcr.io/hmbown/ariadne-router:latest \
  python -c "import ariadne; print(f'âœ… Ariadne {ariadne.__version__} ready!')"

# ğŸ”¬ Full quantum environment (all backends)
docker build --target quantum-full -t ariadne-quantum-full .
docker run -it --name ariadne-dev ariadne-quantum-full

# ğŸ¯ Production deployment with docker-compose
docker-compose up -d ariadne-production

# ğŸ’¾ Development with volume mounting
docker run -it -v $(pwd):/workspace ghcr.io/hmbown/ariadne-router:dev
```

</details>

### âš™ï¸ Configuration Management

<details>
<summary><strong>ğŸ”§ Advanced Configuration</strong></summary>

```python
from ariadne import AriadneConfig, ComprehensiveRoutingTree

# ğŸ›ï¸ Customize routing behavior
config = AriadneConfig(
    default_backend='auto',
    fallback_backend='qiskit',
    enable_caching=True,
    cache_size_mb=512,
    performance_tracking=True,
    log_level='INFO'
)

# ğŸ¯ Create custom router with configuration
router = ComprehensiveRoutingTree(config=config)

# ğŸ”§ Fine-tune backend preferences
router.set_backend_preference('stim', weight=2.0)  # Prefer Stim when available
router.set_hardware_acceleration(True)  # Enable GPU acceleration
router.set_memory_limit_gb(16)  # Set memory constraints

# ğŸš€ Use configured router
result = router.simulate(qc, shots=1000)
```

</details>

## ğŸ“Š Project Status & Metrics

<div align="center">

### ğŸ† Current Release: Version 0.4.4

<table>
<tr>
<td align="center"><strong>ğŸ§ª Test Coverage</strong><br/>319 tests passing<br/>32 skipped (optional deps)</td>
<td align="center"><strong>ğŸ”§ Backends Supported</strong><br/>5 core + 8 optional<br/>Cross-platform compatible</td>
<td align="center"><strong>ğŸ“š Documentation</strong><br/>100+ pages<br/>Interactive examples</td>
</tr>

### ğŸš€ Quick Contribution Setup

```bash
# ğŸ Get started contributing in 30 seconds
git clone https://github.com/Hmbown/ariadne.git
cd ariadne
pip install -e .[dev,apple,viz]
pre-commit install

# ğŸ§ª Run the test suite
pytest tests/ -v

# ğŸ¯ Make your changes and submit a PR!
```

## ğŸ†š Comparison with Alternatives

<div align="center">

| Feature | Ariadne | Manual Backend Selection | Other Routers |
|:--------|:-------:|:----------------------:|:-------------:|
| **Automatic Selection** | âœ… | âŒ | ğŸŸ¡ Limited |
| **Multiple Simulators** | âœ… | ğŸŸ¡ One at a time | ğŸŸ¡ Limited |
| **Educational Tools** | âœ… | âŒ | âŒ |
| **Hardware Acceleration** | âœ… | ğŸŸ¡ Manual setup | ğŸŸ¡ Partial |
| **Transparent Decisions** | âœ… | N/A | âŒ |
| **Research Reproducibility** | âœ… | ğŸŸ¡ Manual | ğŸŸ¡ Limited |
| **Production Ready** | âœ… | ğŸŸ¡ Complex setup | ğŸŸ¡ Varies |

</div>

### âœ… When to Choose Ariadne

- ğŸ“ **Learning quantum computing** - Focus on algorithms, not infrastructure
- ğŸ”¬ **Research projects** - Need reproducible, comparable results
- ğŸ­ **Production systems** - Want reliable, optimized performance
- ğŸ‘¥ **Team environments** - Consistent interface across skill levels
- ğŸ“Š **Benchmarking studies** - Cross-backend validation required

### ğŸ¤” When NOT to Use Ariadne

- ğŸ”§ **Custom simulator research** - Need direct simulator control
- âš¡ **Single-backend optimization** - Already have optimal setup
- ğŸ“± **Embedded systems** - Need minimal dependencies
- ğŸ”’ **Strict environments** - Cannot use external routing logic
